*

Dreaded (With Crude Poetics)

May 10, 2012

And now it is with a vacant compliance that we move among the chic geometric abstractions forming the walls and streets of this city, whatever it is. Everything is out of proportion. The towers, too tall, too skinny. The sidewalks, so long. Yet in the unseen and perpetually setting sun we find ourselves. Montano’s parents approached from down the road. Nothing remarkable in this save that they were being followed by that most foul creature–dare we speak his name? Clad in a black suit, black fedora, and those perfectly circular sunglasses, he is the very model of a scoundrel. Of his deeds we will not speak, of his philosophy we will not even allude. Let the dread and disgust of his name wash over you, poison you, so that you may never encounter this loathsome shade of a man–Lifa.
